dmca.title: [EV1-C1297289R] Trademark Misappropriation in Meta-Tag Source Coding
dmca.body:
T -----Original Message----- From: abuse@ev1.net [mailto:abuse@ev1.net] Posted At: Friday, October 13, 2006 11:22 AM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [EV1-C1297289R] Trademark Misappropriation in Meta-Tag Source Coding Subject: [EV1-C1297289R] Trademark Misappropriation in Meta-Tag Source Coding ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. Trademark Misappropriation in Meta-Tag Source Coding Added by system at Tuesday, Oct 10 2006 02:09 pm X-MailFrom: Libby.Hill@xango.net X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [70.87.6.111] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Tue Oct 10 15:06:43 2006 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Tue, 10 Oct 2006 15:05:51 -0500 Return-path: Delivery-date: Tue, 10 Oct 2006 15:05:51 -0500 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from Libby.Hill@xango.net) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1GXNrL-0006VK-FH for abuse@theplanet.com; Tue, 10 Oct 2006 15:05:51 -0500 Received: from mail.xango.net ([67.128.38.15] helo=xmailfe01.xango.net) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from Libby.Hill@xango.net) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GXNrI-000DUM-Lb for abuse@theplanet.com; Tue, 10 Oct 2006 15:05:49 -0500 Received: from xmail01.xango.net ([10.200.0.15]) by xmailfe01.xango.net with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Tue, 10 Oct 2006 14:05:45 -0600 X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5 Content-class: urn:content-classes:message MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C6ECA7.78CCC7FD" Subject: Trademark Misappropriation in Meta-Tag Source Coding Date: Tue, 10 Oct 2006 14:05:45 -0600 Message-ID: <0FBB3D088ADF0F45A0696C2F3A1F6CDA048C19D7@xmail01.xango.net> X-MS-Has-Attach: X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: Trademark Misappropriation in Meta-Tag Source Coding Thread-Index: Acbsp3MMZbC/x6RTTJC7O84hIZq58g== From: "Libby Hill" To: Cc: X-OriginalArrivalTime: 10 Oct 2006 20:05:45.0767 (UTC) FILETIME=[78D6BB70:01C6ECA7] Received-SPF: none (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: 67.128.38.15 is neither permitted nor denied by domain of xango.net) client-ip=67.128.38.15; envelope-from=Libby.Hill@xango.net; helo=xmailfe01.xango.net; (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) October 10, 2006 VIA E-MAIL: generalmanager@domainsbyproxy.com Original to Follow Via Certified Mail Domains by Proxy, Inc. Attn: Legal Complaints 15111 N. Hayden Road, Suite 160 PMB 353 Scottsdale, AZ 85260 Re: Trademark Misappropriation in Meta-Tag Source Coding Our File: 10385 Dear Sirs: It has come to our attention that a website registered through your company has unlawfully misappropriated our corporate trademark. Consequently, we demand that you immediately take action to remove any and all references to the XanGo® trademark from this site. Specifically, the website www.mikeandpete.com, for which you are listed as registrant (see enclosed "Whois" information), attempts to capitalize on the goodwill of our XanGo® trademark and profit from the power of our trademark as a source identifier by employing hidden text versions of "XANGO" in its meta-tag source coding (see enclosed). It is obvious that the registrants of this site are attempting to divert internet traffic to their website by confusing consumers searching for our mark while promoting a business unrelated to XanGo, LLC. Please be advised that we have protectable rights in the XANGO® trademark and these actions violate a number of federal and state laws, including but not limited to Section 43 of the Lanham Act, 15 U.S.C. §1125. As you may know, violations of the Lanham Act entitle the holder of a mark to recover the infringer's profits, any damages sustained by the holder of the mark, as well as the cost of the litigation. By copy of this letter to ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc., we are notifying them of this attempt to disparage our trademark through the above-listed site. Use of the XANGO® trademark is unauthorized and we have a good faith belief that any continued misuse of the mark is likely to cause confusion, to cause mistake, or to deceive, all in violation of federal trademark law. See 15 U.S.C. §114(1)(a). We determined their involvement in this matter by running a trace route on the above web address which yielded an IP address of 70.86.13.2. It is our understanding that ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. maintains the net block 70.84.0.0 - 70.87.255.255. Accordingly, we demand that you immediately take whatever action is necessary to cease and desist the above-identified trademark misappropriation. Please respond to this demand no later than ten business days after the date noted above. If you fail to do so, we will be forced to take legal action to protect our rights, including disabling all access to the above infringing and illegal web page. Any inaction or failure to respond on your part will be a factor when we consider our next course of action in this matter. If you have any questions, you may contact me at libby.hill@xango.net. Sincerely, XANGO, LLC Libby Hill Legal Department cc: Abuse Department at ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. (abuse@theplanet.com) MIME element (text/html)

October 10, 2006

 

VIA E-MAIL: generalmanager@domainsbyproxy.com

Original to Follow Via Certified Mail

 

Domains by Proxy, Inc.

Attn:
